macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indices Decline on January 30 Amid Fed Chair Nomination News
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.43% to 6939 points, Dow Jones dropped 0.85% to around 48,656, and Nasdaq Composite declined 0.66% to 23,528, driven by Fed chair nomination uncertainty and mixed earnings. Despite Friday's pullback, all indices posted monthly gains: S&P 500 +1.8%, Dow +2.1%, Nasdaq +1.9%.[1][2]

items.title: Verizon Surges 6.6% on Strong Earnings Beat
items.summary: Verizon shares jumped 6.6% after reporting stronger-than-expected results, standing out amid broader market declines. Chevron also rose 0.5% on a profit beat, while American Express tumbled 3.1% following an earnings miss.[1]

items.title: Federal Reserve Chair Nomination Sparks Market Pullback
items.summary: Investors reacted to the nomination of a new Federal Reserve chair, leading to sharp losses in financial stocks and a broader risk-off move, with Dow falling steeper than S&P 500. The news heightened policy uncertainty around monetary leadership.[2]

items.title: Indian Markets End Lower Ahead of Union Budget
items.summary: BSE Sensex fell 0.36% to 82,270 and Nifty 50 dropped 0.39% to 25,321 as investors turned cautious before the weekend budget presentation, snapping a three-day rally.[2]

items.title: Mixed Tech Stock Performance: Apple Down, Alphabet Up Slightly
items.summary: Apple closed at 254.77, down 1.36%, while Alphabet edged up 0.11% to 338.61 and Microsoft fell slightly, reflecting varied sector moves on January 30.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops to $82,564 Amid $752M Long Liquidations
items.summary: Bitcoin experienced a sharp selloff triggered by $752 million in long liquidations, dropping to $82,564 as of January 30, 2026. The decline was exacerbated by speculation about the next Federal Reserve chair potentially tightening monetary policy.

items.title: Gold and Silver Crash $6 Trillion in Market Cap; Crypto Rotation Fails to Materialize
items.summary: Gold and silver markets experienced a historic $6 trillion loss in market cap in a single day, but the expected liquidity rotation into Bitcoin has not occurred, leaving crypto isolated with its own volatility.

items.title: U.S. Regulatory Framework for Cryptocurrency Expected in 2026
items.summary: U.S. senators have drafted a complete regulatory framework that could clearly define crypto tokens as securities, commodities, or other investments, with the CFTC taking regulatory authority. The framework could increase institutional and retail investor participation.

items.title: Bitcoin Anticipated to Consolidate Between $75,000-$100,000 in First Half of 2026
items.summary: According to NS3.AI and Bitwise CIO Matt Hougan, Bitcoin is expected to consolidate within a $75,000 to $100,000 range during the first half of 2026, with potential breakout later in the year as regulatory clarity improves.

items.title: Ethereum Shows Supply Shock as Large Holders Consolidate Into Staking
items.summary: Ethereum large wallets are consolidating funds into staking contracts rather than selling on exchanges, creating a potential bullish supply shock. However, price action remains tied to Bitcoin and broader market bearish sentiment.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Helix 02 Released Amid AI Advancements and Self-Driving Insurance Cuts
items.summary: Dr. Alan D. Thompson's latest Memo highlights the release of Helix 02, a 50% insurance reduction for self-driving vehicles, AI models exhibiting sadder emotional tones, and predictions of recursive AI improvement within 1-2 years leading to autonomous model building.

items.title: NYC Mayor Mamdani Plans to Shut Down Faulty AI Chatbot
items.summary: New York City mayor Zohran Mamdani announced plans to terminate a Microsoft-powered AI chatbot that advised businesses to break the law, citing it as unusable and costing $500,000 amid budget cuts.

items.title: GE HealthCare Advances AI in Healthcare with Faster Scans and Efficiency Tools
items.summary: GE HealthCare is deploying AI-enabled devices like AIR Recon DL for up to 50% faster imaging scans, generative AI for clinical trial matching, and machine learning Command Center for hospital operational efficiency amid workforce shortages.

items.title: UN Experts Warn of AI Job Risks, Urge Education and Global Cooperation
items.summary: UN report emphasizes education for AI literacy, adaptability in changing work roles, equitable access to AI tools, and international collaboration to mitigate job losses and inequality from AI transformation.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Google's Project Genie Announcement Causes Gaming Stocks to Plummet
items.summary: Google unveiled Project Genie, an AI world model for generating 3D virtual spaces from text, prompting sharp declines in shares of Take-Two Interactive (10%), Roblox (12%), and Unity (21%). The tool is seen as potentially revolutionizing game development, though Google states it enhances prototyping rather than replacing game engines.

items.title: 2K Announces WWE 2K26 with CM Punk on Cover and New Features
items.summary: 2K revealed WWE 2K26, featuring CM Punk on the cover, four new match types, upgrades to all game modes, and an unprecedented roster. The game is developed by Visual Concepts as the latest in the flagship WWE video game franchise.

items.title: Beyond Good & Evil 2 Creative Director Confirms Project Unaffected by Ubisoft Layoffs
items.summary: Amid Ubisoft layoffs and game cancellations, Beyond Good & Evil 2 creative director Fawzi Mesmar stated the team remains committed and focused on delivering a remarkable game. The project was unaffected by recent changes.

items.title: Over Half of Game Developers Say Generative AI is Hurting the Industry
items.summary: The GDC 2026 State of the Game Industry report reveals a sharp increase in developers believing generative AI is damaging the games industry. This sentiment grows amid rising AI adoption in development.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Apple Launches Second-Generation AirTag with Improved Findability
items.summary: Apple has released a new AirTag featuring a more powerful chip for enhanced tracking capabilities. The upgrade aims to improve item location accuracy.

items.title: Tesla Discontinues Model S and Model X to Focus on Optimus Robots
items.summary: Tesla announced it will end production of Model S and Model X vehicles, repurposing factory space for Optimus humanoid robot manufacturing with a goal of 1 million units annually. Elon Musk emphasized robots as Tesla's future, citing China as the primary competitor.

items.title: Tesla Invests $2 Billion in xAI and Shifts to Robot Production
items.summary: Tesla revealed a $2 billion investment in Elon Musk’s xAI while officially discontinuing Model S and Model X to prioritize humanoid robots. Musk predicts significant production scaling by year-end.

items.title: Samsung Teases Pixel-Level Privacy Feature for Galaxy S26
items.summary: Samsung is preparing a new 'pixel level' privacy feature for its upcoming Galaxy S26 phones, allowing secure entry of sensitive information in public. This move addresses escalating data protection concerns.

items.title: Startup Gains FDA Approval for First Partial De-Aging Human Trial
items.summary: A startup co-founded by a Harvard genetics professor received FDA approval for the first partial de-aging human trial amid billionaires' pursuit of immortality. The development marks a milestone in biotech innovation.
